Reviews.Title: Slim and beautiful but sub-par picture quality
Reviews.Author: Christian Cote "RadXGe"
Reviews.Content: I have been playing with a new Samsung UN32C4000 for a week now and the following contains the results of my findings.1)Basic FeaturesThis monitor is the cheapest 32" LED on the market.  The resolution is limited to 720p which is perfectly fine for a TV of this size.The UN32C4000 is well equipped in terms of input (4 HDMI 1.3 ports, 1 USB, 1 component input, 1 optical sound input and 1 PC input).The HDMI input are located on the left side of the monitors.  IMO, the inputs are too close from the bezel so that my HDMI cables are visible from the side.  HDMI angle cables may be more suited for slim monitors like this one.Edge-lit LCDs are known for having uniformity issues but my unit displays was fine in this area.Backlight bleeding is minor and should not be an issue for most.Black level displayed by this monitor proves to be significantly better than my 2 years old Samsung LN32A450.However, watching the Dark Knight movie was a bit painful to my trained eyes.  This tv is not suited for movie watching due to lack of details in shadows.The OSD is well designed and makes the calibration a bit easier compared to the LN32A450.I really want to point out that this TV is really beautiful due its ultra slim design and the familiar Touch of Color Design.2) Advanced FeaturesCalibration was done with he help of a Enhanced Chroma 5 meter (LED compliant).  Unfortunately, the results are disappointing.a) RGB Color Balance (GreyScale)  Calibration was done by modifying the white balance adjustments (RGB-Offset and RGB-Gain).  The white point target is the usual 6500 as defined by HD Rec709.  While the 20%-100% stimulus are good, the 10% stimulus is way too blue (Color temperature (CT) of 8900!).  All DeltaE errors are below 3 and the average CT is 6685 (6450 if 10% stimulus is ignored).b) Gamut  I found out that this TV has not CMS control.  This is a big let down since the user manual clearly specifies that a custom color space is available (p.16) but it is NOT there in the OSD.  Thus, I was only able to modify the gamut by adjusting the clumsy Color setting.  Fortunately, the end result is satisfying since the delta errors are below 5 for all primaries and secondaries.c) Gamma (Target of 2.2)  Let me be clear here, the gamma curve is awful.  Gamma is stable between the 10% to 50% stimulus but drops into the abyss between 60% and 90%.  Adjusting the gamma control uniformly shifts gamma over all stimulus and does not solve the instability issue.  Nothing can be done here since there is no 10 points gamma adjustments like the UN32C6500 (more advanced) model.3) SummaryI have found out that the picture quality of the UN32C4000 is generally inferior to its 2 years old predecessor, the LN32A450.While the slim design will be missed, I will exchange this TV for the cheaper and hopefully better Samsung LN32C450.4) Calibration Settings for optimal pictureMode: StandardBacklight: 9Contrast: 82Brightness: 42Sharpness: 50Color: 46Tin: G42/R48Shadow Details: +1Gamma:+2White balance: R-Offset:30 G-Offset:25 B-Offset:23 R-Gain:17 G-Gain:35 B-Gain:18Color Tone: Warm2

Reviews.Title: Gets the Job Done
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: For the price, available features, quality, size, and power consumption this set does a great job.  Above all, this set is THIN!!!  Holy cow is it thin!  At the same time, this set is relatively light versus a CFL backlight TV.Moving on, blacks and the overall color range is pretty good on this set.  Backlight bleeding is minimal for blacks and I've fooled around with color/contrast/brightness settings to find my comfort zone.  Please, please do the same because factory settings are 99% wrong for most folks.I've done research about 1080 vs. 720 resolution and found a general rule of thumb, "If the set is around 32"/42" or less then you won't see a difference between 1080 and 720."  So far I have to agree.  Granted I do not have a Blu-Ray player to provide an ultimate result, but with what I do have I am satisfied.  Which brought me to another conclusion when shopping for a new TV.If you buy a fancy 1080p set and hook it up to a poor signal then you wasted your money.  Meaning, if you don't provide a solid 1080 signal then you won't use the full ability of the set.  On that, just because you use HDMI does not mean you have a 1080 signal!  In my case, the cable company provides 720 resolution and if the landlord allowed it, I would go with a satellite company to find true 1080 signal.Aside from picture quality, sound quality is so so as most integrated sound systems are.  On the bright side I believe the speakers hit a moderate range of sound, but don't expect amazing bass or high tones.Last of all, I am not a huge sports fan, but when I watched the Super Bowl on this set I was impressed.  In fact, I might start watching more games now that I have this TV.

Reviews.Title: I think it rocks!
Reviews.Author: Ted Ingram "Ted Ingram"
Reviews.Content: I just read all the other reviews. I see a lot of negative comments, and I am a bit confused. OK, so here is me. Average guy, I like gadgets, and I like my stuff to work when I turn it on. I am not and audio/visual nerd. I have satellite TV (now, ditched cable mostly because of this TV in my bedroom) and I work a lot. I just want to enjoy my things.I also won this TV. Long story, but I did. Look folks, if you are anything like me and are not going to break out your tricorder or whatever some of these folks were using, have a decent HD signal, and just want a really great, slim, and attractive TV, buy this thing!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Neil Mcpherson "koolkid"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 32-inch TV for our bedroom. I followed a reviewer's calibration settings, and found the picture quality to be less than desirable. I set it back to the default, and it once again looked like a Samsung LED TV, instead of an old CRT tube.I own the 40-inch Samsung LED (1080p, 120Hz), so I have a good reference point.

Reviews.Title: LIGHTWEIGHT AND INNOVATIVE
Reviews.Author: goodnumber8
Reviews.Content: The picture is so vivid you can see makeup lines. Color brilliant. I haven't mastered the sound but I have options. I didn't need technical assistance plugging in the connections. Veiwing is a pleasure. Even the person who delivered the box commented on how lightweight the set was. I often have to do a channel search because the signal gets lost. I've lost local channels. The plug in's, the sentive touch of the controls, even the remote in innovative.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: J. Outman "Tech Guy 10"
Reviews.Content: Got this TV with overnight shipping for 3.99 (as a Prime Member). Very easy setup. The TV is really light, razor thin, and has allot of great features. The picture and color is great on this set and the USB port is excellent for playing MKV files off a external hard drive. Very very happy with my purchase!UPDATE: I ended up returning this TV as I couldnt get the colors right even after calibration, just wasnt the TV for me. Went with the LG 32LD550 LCD TV and all is well now.

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV with GREAT Picture
Reviews.Author: TheRoyalMan
Reviews.Content: As far as the quality of the picture is concerned this is the best 720p tv out there. For the setup and installation of the tv it was very easy. I bought the tv refurbished from amazon and the only thing that was missing was one screw. At least it was not an important one. The tv has great sound quality and it uses very little power on eco-mode.

Reviews.Title: Cable Box cutomers-Take note
Reviews.Author: H. Bowman "Mailman"
Reviews.Content: Picked up Samsung 4005 e-series at Costco...Guess its same as 4000...389.00 after 50.00 off...Well I got it home set-up HDMI....Picture great...But no sound! Called Samsung...Costco tech........We did sound test.....There is a sound tone when you turn on and it was ok...The Rep said I should exchange cable Box because HDMI port was bad.....Oh yes! the Com hook-up was fine...The orig wires from cable company (5).....To make a long story short....I went into cablebox setting and just changed ( audio source) to HDMI.....It was on ( other)...Its great now....Hope this helps you....I need to buy a 2nd Roku or DVD player thats internet capable...

Reviews.Title: UltraSlim=UltraAwesome
Reviews.Author: P. M. Bolish "pete the geek"
Reviews.Content: This one fits the bill.  At a mere 1.7" deep(w/o base), this low end spectrum LED HDTV packs a dynamic punch.  Great picture even with standard cable, analog, and PC inputs.  Fantastic HD picture for 720p 60Hz specs.  Sleek modern design combined with a great viewing angle and size make the value to price ratio for this product excellent. All in all, it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Crisp and Clear
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my son and it is wonderful.  The picture is so crisp and clear.  Nice for his extra room.  Definitely recommend the LED.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32" LED TV
Reviews.Author: Sturgis
Reviews.Content: I believe Samsung TV puts out an excellent product, however they need to improve on there sound system.  I purchased a smaller Samsung TV as well as this 32" and the sound has to be turned up full in order to hear.  The 32" side has acceptable sound levels.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: BKT "BKT"
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about not actually seeing this close up before buying it, but it arrived in excellent shape and has worked perfectly since I got it.  I guess I've had it a year or two now and have had no problems. The picture is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Junk.  DOA 4x in 1 year. Repeated repairs
Reviews.Author: Peter K. Ledoux "coius"
Reviews.Content: We bought this around christmas about 2 years ago.  While the display worked fine for about 6 months, the screen started to lag (aka the sound was fine, it looked like it was doing about 1-4 Frames/sec) then the display would stop, and all the colors would fade to black.So we went it into samsung.  15 days later, it arrived. Samsung did ZERO packing and it was so loose it punched a hole through the side of the box. Fearing the worst, I opened the box (Carefully) to find the bezel around the display was smashed.  The LCD was caved in and parts of it was falling loose in the box (aka the LCD had a hole punched in).  Samsung was immediately called and we sent back to have the display and bezel replaced.4 months after this fiasco, our HDMI ports started dying one by one. The TV would shut off randomly (even on the TV Tuner which was on over the air TV).  No kids or pets in the house and only one person watching, the TV was deemed defective a 2nd time.  We called the store we bought extended warranty.  A company came out (name ommited, they were very good about it) and they replaced the logic board in our home.  3 months go by, the logic board again fails (HDMI ports, etc..) so it was replaced again.  About 2 weeks ago, issues happened.  The same company, came out and swapped in a new logic board.  2 days later similar (but slightly different) issues crop up with this board, and now possibly the power supply is on the fritz.  randomly, video would stop streaming from our Apple TV, the BluRay (a samsung BD-ROM player), the Mac Mini (I tested it) or my macbook pro or thinkpad, but audio would keep going.  The TosLink port with a pioneer receiver would randomly either stop working (not even a light) or would garble the audio. HDMI into the receiver would not do this.  Also, TV 3 seperate times would turn on on it's own (no Remote) or would turn off 2 seconds after turning on.  New batteries/different remote didn't not solve issue. I am going out to the store we bought it from (during berkshire hathoway days) and am going to invoke the lemon warranty  on this.  This will be the 4th time the logic board will be replaced in ONE year.Not happy.  My friend has a cheap-o vizio still working.My friend also has a Samsung (72" LED) and 3 of the 4 HDMI ports don't work, and the tv randomly turns off (did so during a Husker's football game) and now lines are randomly appearing/disappearing on his screen. His was bought slightly before mine was.Not happy.  Newer samsungs may be better, but this was pure junk.  Wished I never paid the $650 I paid originally (plus I paid the $150 extended warranty. Well worth it!)  Here I was worried about backlights going out (common on cheaper CCFL TVs),  It seems everything but that has died on this!

Reviews.Content: The TV upgraded a non-HDTV.  It is fine for most viewing.  It is not the best for high speed action such as sports, but still OK.

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV!
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for Christmas and it is just awesome.  It's so thin (1.2") and has great picture quality and sound.  The contrast ratio is brilliant (2,000,000!).  In fact, the blacks are so deep that I sometimes can't tell if the TV is on or off when theres nothing showing on the TV.  It looks beautiful too!  720p is enough for a TV this size and 60HZ is good too.  If you're looking for a great LED-LCD TV look no further than this Samsung!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV

Reviews.Content: I really like TV. The picture is clear and very sharp. I've just got it and haven't had the chance to try all the features as of yet. It came to me very fast and well packed and my UPS guy rang the door bell and made sure I knew he brought the TV. NO complaints about delivery or the shipping process. Happy with my TV!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV

Reviews.Content: I like the TV.  Very slim and clear picture.  I have two TV's and both are Samsumg(s) so obviously I have faith in the quality of their TV's.I use it as our 2nd TV, so I didn't get a high definition box, and the picture still looks pretty good.  I considered a slightly larger TV, but I think that 32 inches is the largest TV that can be watched enjoyably without an HD box.
